hook.text: Diamonds aren't rare. De Beers just convinced everyone they were. Scarcity is often manufactured.

buildup.text: When supply drops, desire spikes. It's basic economics paired with deep psychology.

discovery.text: Researchers gave kids identical cookies from two jars. The jar with fewer cookies 'tasted better.'

twist.text: Fake scarcity erodes trust fast. 'Only 3 left!' loses power when it says that every single day.

climax.text: Real scarcity works because it forces a deadline. Genuine limits create genuine urgency.

punchline.text: We want what we might not be able to have.

quiz.question: What did the cookie jar experiment prove about scarcity?
options: Fewer cookies tasted better to children
